titleStmt.title: Gods protecting providence, man's surest help and defence in the times of the greatest difficulty and most imminent danger evidenced in the remarkable deliverance of divers persons from the devouring waves of the sea, amongst which they suffered shipwrack : and also from the more cruelly devouring jawes of the inhumane canibals of Florida / faithfully related by one of the persons concerned therein, Jonathan Dickenson.
titleStmt.author: Dickinson, Jonathan, 1663-1722.

titleStmt.title: Gods protecting providence, man's surest help and defence in the times of the greatest difficulty and most imminent danger evidenced in the remarkable deliverance of divers persons from the devouring waves of the sea, amongst which they suffered shipwrack : and also from the more cruelly devouring jawes of the inhumane canibals of Florida / faithfully related by one of the persons concerned therein, Jonathan Dickenson.
titleStmt.author: Dickinson, Jonathan, 1663-1722.

notesStmt.note: An account of a shipwreck and the ensuing hardships in which Robert Barrow dies.
Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
